Key Match Events: Brayan Bello delivered the longest outing of his career, pitching eight innings of two-hit ball.
Tyler O'Neill hit a two-run homer off reliever Brendon Little in the eighth inning.
Kenley Jansen pitched a perfect ninth for his 25th save.
Post-Match Reflections: Brayan Bello expressed his enjoyment of the game and the importance of staying focused.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora praised Bello's performance as his best outing in the big leagues.
Bello emphasized the importance of winning the game to keep moving forward in their playoff push.
Miscellaneous Highlights: David Hamilton injured a finger when he tried to bunt and left the game in the top of the ninth.
The game was attended by 32,809 people at Fenway Park.
